TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
what you'll do...
position: manager ii, workforce planning
job location: 702 sw 8th st, bentonville, ar 72712
duties: manages workforce planning projects by establishing priorities and goals; developing action plans; obtaining and allocating resources; monitoring progress toward project milestones; organizing, facilitating, and directing cross-functional meetings to share information, evaluate progress, and implement changes; developing, implementing, and analyzing metrics to measure project success; summarizing and evaluating project results; and communicating project status with key stakeholders and cross-functional partners. drives the continuous improvement of workforce planning programs and processes by developing methodologies to report program and process performance; reporting key trends and compliance risks; analyzing new and historical performance data to determine root cause of issues; recommending and presenting remedies and solutions regarding compliance issues and risks; and working with senior management to finalize and implement solutions. supports project execution by ensuring compliance with project procedures and guidelines; advising on, executing, and documenting organizational practices and company, legal, and regulatory policies and procedures; and evaluating and responding to issues and concerns regarding analytics practices and procedures. develops and evaluates business tools and core statistical models by understanding complex business needs and scope of work; designing tools, statistical models, and reporting infrastructure; building or providing guidance on building data infrastructure, databases, and tools; determining the business impact of data infrastructure, databases, and tools; testing and evaluating pilot solutions before implementation; verifying results; and interpreting data and results into actionable initiatives for business partners. provides data based insights in support of strategic initiatives by assisting with the design of statistical or heuristic models for applications involving multiple statistical techniques and stakeholders; coordinating the development of complete datasets necessary to support project-level models; coordinating with internal and external customers to build a consistent and accurate strategy for using functional area metrics; partnering on statistical or segmentation models to advance the approach; assisting with analyses utilizing advanced software and techniques; and evaluating and interpreting results and presenting in different formats and different forums.
minimum education and experience required: bachelor's degree or the equivalent in computer science, analytics, statistics, or related field and 2 years of experience in data analytics or related field; or 4 years of experience in data analytics or related field.
skills required: must have experience with: teradata; shell scripting; db2; interactive reporting and dashboards; data visualization; agile methodology; data management; change management; and statistical analysis. employer will accept any amount of experience with the required skills.
wal-mart is an equal opportunity employer.
#li-dnp #li-dni

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
:
bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, business, or related field and 4+ years of experience in communications, journalism, business, or relevant area or 8+ years of experience in technical writing, engineering, product, or a related technical field
ability to quickly learn technical information
excellent analytical and written communication skills
high attention to detail and commitment to excellence
project-management experience
ability to work independently
preferred qualifications: 
8+ years of experience working with cross-functional teams
understanding of api basics
experience with a version-control system such as git
team management experience
previous exposure to online advertising industry
ability to make documentation-related edits directly to our java codebase
about walmart connect
at walmart, we enable the connection between supplier brands and retail shoppers at unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, "save money. live better," we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. we believe all digital advertising can be targeted and accountable – and we have walmart's sales data to prove it.
benefits & perks: 
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. 
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com
at walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. paid time off benefits include pto (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, military leave pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
you will also receive pto and/or ppto that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. the amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. it will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. for information about pto, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .
live better u is a walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in walmart and sam's club facilities. programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including english language learning and short-form certificates. tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by walmart.
eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. for information about benefits and eligibility, see one.walmart at https://bit.ly/3ioob1j .
the annual salary range for this position is $97,500.00-$162,500.00
additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.
additional compensation for certain positions may also include:
- regional pay zone (rpz) (based on location)
- stock equity incentives

benefits & perks: 
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. 
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com

 at walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. paid time off benefits include pto (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, military leave pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
you will also receive pto and/or ppto that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. the amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. it will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. for information about pto, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .
live better u is a walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in walmart and sam's club facilities. programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including english language learning and short-form certificates. tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by walmart.
eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. for information about benefits and eligibility, see one.walmart at https://bit.ly/3ioob1j .
the annual salary range for this position is $64,480.00-$100,000.00
additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.
additional compensation for certain positions may also include:
- regional pay zone (rpz) (based on location)
- stock equity incentives

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
.
actively participate in new business initiatives and support business improvement projects.
provides assistance to department with calendars and organizes meeting activities by helping managers and team with scheduling, maintaining, and updating calendar events; resolving scheduling and meetings; assisting with planning and coordination of department or divisional activities and meetings; and managing, maintaining, and scheduling meeting rooms.
evaluating and submitting supply requests within department budget; ensuring office equipment is maintained; acting as a coordinator or liaison for visiting associates and guests; receiving, interpreting, and processing invoices and expense reports; planning and preparing for key events or dates; monitoring deadlines and communicating between relevant partners; scheduling travel-related activities; and coordinating and monitoring completion of department or business-related processes.
incumbent will assist with completing thorough background investigations on candidate drivers and ensure they meet the federal motor carrier safety administration (fmcsa) regulations and walmart minimum qualifications to drive and haul freight on behalf of the company.
actively participate in new business initiatives and support business improvement projects; collaborate with field and home office operation partners to achieve driver hiring goals and initiatives.

ensures regulatory compliance by managing the brand process by gathering required documentation from suppliers or global sourcing; entering brand information into the system; advising key stakeholders that the brand is available.

coordinates activities of different departments by serving as a key contact to internal and external stakeholders on matters related to purchase orders, templates, and revisions; updating distribution lists; writing and updating procedures in collaboration with management to ensure accuracy of processes; providing support for buy trips. leads and participates in teams by using and sharing resources, information, and tools; determining customer needs and business priorities; coordinating and executing work assignments; providing advice, feedback, and support to ensure timelines and work quality are achieved; and modeling and helping others with how to adapt to change or new challenges.
develops, communicates, and implements processes and practices to meet business needs by collaborating with managers, co-workers, customers, and other business partners; analyzing and applying information from multiple sources; monitoring progress and results; and identifying and addressing improvement opportunities.
demonstrates, promotes, and supports compliance with company policies, procedures, and standards of ethics and integrity by explaining, guiding, and demonstrating how to apply these in executing business processes and practices; implementing related action plans; using the open door policy; and assisting management with correcting ethical and compliance issues and problems.
 candidates need to be familiar with all or some of the following…
•            federal motor carrier safety administrations (fmcsa) regulations.
•            department of transportation (dot) safety operations.
•            strong auditing, problem solving and critical thinking skills with the ability to recognize when data is inaccurate and recommend solutions to solve for. 
•            understand and execute investigation processes.
nice to haves...
•            natmi-north america transportation management institute certification(s).
•            experience with transportation safety programs in retail.
•            skills for data management and analytics.
•            experience with walmart systems: workday, jj keller-encompass, supervision, tableau, onewalmart, etc.
live our values
culture champion
• models the walmart values to foster our culture; holds oneself accountable; and supports walmart’s commitment to communities, social justice, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability; maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics and compliance.
servant leadership
• is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent.
embrace change
curiosity & courage
• demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; supports innovation and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks.
digital transformation & change
• implements and supports continuous improvements and willingly embraces new digital tools and ways of working.
deliver for the customer
customer focus
• delivers results while putting the customer first and applying an omnimerchant mindset and the edlp and edlc business models to all plans.
strategic thinking
• adopts a broad perspective that considers data, analytics, customer insights, and different parts of the business when making plans.
focus on our associates
diversity, equity & inclusion
• embraces diversity in all its forms and actively supports diversity of ideas and perspectives, as well as diversity goal programs.
collaboration & influence
• builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively to achieve objectives; communicates with
impact to a range of audiences; and demonstrates energy and positivity for own work.
talent management
• contributes to an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work, demonstrates engagement and commitment to the team, and recognizes others’
contributions and accomplishments.

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
what you'll do...
position: senior manager, risk assessment - compliance
job location: 702 sw 8th street, bentonville, ar 72716
duties: maintain and protect anti-corruption monitoring and testing data by identifying and implementing risk management systems solutions; manage data within the systems solution; and maintain the privilege and confidentiality of anti-corruption monitoring and testing. organize, plan, and participate in the anti-corruption monitoring and testing process to determine root causes of opportunities for improvement by ensuring continuous improvement and maturity of the anti-corruption monitoring and testing process; manage anti-corruption monitoring and testing methodology for different types of assessments to ensure consistency in application; complete risk assessments; create deliverables and actionable plans to manage identified opportunities; provide advice and analysis regarding key decisions required to achieve business objectives; develop and implement internal training;; assess risk data for trends; and implement solutions for risk trends identified. develop and maintain relationships with internal client organizations to stay informed of and act upon company strategies, new business ventures, and operational issues by developing and leveraging key internal and external partnerships and networks to maximize achievement of business goals; collect information on new business ventures, issues that go beyond core retailing, and multiple business structures; research implications of applicable laws and regulations; analyze exposure and cost benefit opportunities based on the needs of the business; serve as an internal expert to advise on potential exposure; and participate in and support community outreach events.
minimum education and experience required: bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in finance or a related field plus 2 years of experience in compliance, risk management, or related field or 4 years of experience in compliance, risk management, or related field.
skills required: must have experience with: compliance with the foreign corrupt practices act (fcpa); monitoring and audit practices, including planning of monitoring activities, information gathering, sample selection, testing execution, documentation of observations; development and review of monitoring and audit reports; risk management processes, including assessment of operational, financial and compliance processes risk, internal controls efficacy and efficiency, and the development, implementation, and maintenance of monitoring programs; applying and reviewing the effectiveness of an anti-corruption program and controls in international locations, as well as functionality at local level; remediation and control implementation processes, with focus on prevention of corruption; erp sap, financial systems, monitoring and audit systems and information analysis; project management over international locations; transaction analysis and identification with control deficiency and corruption risk; forensic accounting; third-party audits including the assessment of third-party adherence to the anti-corruption requirements, interactions with government entities and officials, certain aspects of the compliance environment; and doj fcpa monitorships. employer will accept any amount of experience with the required skills.
#li-dnp #li-dni
wal-mart is an equal opportunity employer.

benefits & perks: 
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. 
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
:
four-year college degree.
ability to lead day-to-day relationships and work with management and multifunctional teams to respond to supplier needs.
experience in building media plan recommendations.
excellent follow-through and no hesitation in ensuring accountability across teams.
meticulously detail-oriented project management to ensure we increase the strength of our relationships with suppliers and their investment in walmart advertising.
familiarity with analytics, advertising data/tech, and dmp technologies, paired with strong analytical and quantitative skills, problem-solving.
resourceful in maneuvering through a large company while working in a nimble and fast paced environment – ability to adapt and thrive in any business situation.
willingness and desire to be a key individual contributor and strong team player.
strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills along with cross company and partner collaboration skills. ability to be clear, concise, and effective in communication.
capability to work proactively under pressure and handling multiple ad hoc requests.
high level of comfort escalating and presenting key issues to management.
tactical and strategic thinker to help influence suppliers’ investment in walmart media/advertising.
about walmart connect
at walmart, we are passionate in our endeavor to continuously bridge the gap between supplier brands and retail shoppers at an unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, “save money. live better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a growing, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. our team believes all digital advertising can be targeted and quantified – and we have walmart’s sales data to prove it! our team and our supplier partners win when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth for their business both online and offline.
benefits & perks
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. 
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life.
www.careers.walmart.com
the salary wage range for this position is $97500 to $162500*
at walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. paid time off benefits include pto (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, military leave pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
you will also receive pto and/or ppto that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. the amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. it will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. for information about pto, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .
live better u is a walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in walmart and sam's club facilities. programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including english language learning and short-form certificates. tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by walmart.
eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. for information about benefits and eligibility, see one.walmart at https://bit.ly/3ioob1j .
additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.
additional compensation for certain positions may also include:
- regional pay zone (rpz) (based on location)
- stock equity incentives

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
associate's degree in business, finance, computer science or related field or 1 year’s experience in project management, business, operations, or related area. preferred qualifications project management certification. six sigma certification.

live our values
culture champion
• models the walmart values to foster our culture; holds oneself and others accountable; and supports walmart’s commitment to communities, social justice, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability; maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics and compliance.
servant leadership
• acts as an altruistic servant leader and is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent.
embrace change
curiosity & courage
• demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; fosters an environment that supports learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks.
digital transformation & change
• seeks and implements continuous improvements and encourages the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working.
deliver for the customer
customer focus
• delivers expected business results while putting the customer first and consistently applying an omni-merchant mindset and the edlp and edlc business models to all plans.
strategic thinking
• adopts a holistic perspective that considers data, analytics, customer insights, and different parts of the business when making plans and shaping the team’s strategy.
focus on our associates
diversity, equity & inclusion
• identifies, attracts, and retains diverse and inclusive team members; builds a high-performing team; embraces diversity in all its forms; and actively supports diversity goal programs.
collaboration & influence
• builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives; and communicates with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action.
talent management
• creates a discipline and focus around developing talent, promotes an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work, empowers associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer and company, and regularly recognizes others’ contributions and accomplishments.

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
:
four-year college degree.
ability to lead day-to-day relationships and work with management and multifunctional teams to respond to supplier needs.
experience in building media plan recommendations.
excellent follow-through and no hesitation in ensuring accountability across teams.
meticulously detail-oriented project management to ensure we increase the strength of our relationships with suppliers and their investment in walmart advertising.
familiarity with analytics, advertising data/tech, and dmp technologies, paired with strong analytical and quantitative skills, problem-solving.
resourceful in maneuvering through a large company while working in a nimble and fast paced environment – ability to adapt and thrive in any business situation.
willingness and desire to be a key individual contributor and strong team player.
strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills along with cross company and partner collaboration skills. ability to be clear, concise, and effective in communication.
capability to work proactively under pressure and handling multiple ad hoc requests.
high level of comfort escalating and presenting key issues to management.
tactical and strategic thinker to help influence suppliers’ investment in walmart media/advertising.
about walmart connect
at walmart, we are passionate in our endeavor to continuously bridge the gap between supplier brands and retail shoppers at an unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, “save money. live better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a growing, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. our team believes all digital advertising can be targeted and quantified – and we have walmart’s sales data to prove it! our team and our supplier partners win when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth for their business both online and offline.
benefits & perks
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.

at walmart, we are passionate in our endeavor to continuously bridge the gap between supplier brands and retail shoppers at an unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, “save money. live better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a growing, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. our team believes all digital advertising can be targeted and quantified – and we have walmart’s sales data to prove it! our team and our supplier partners win when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth for their business both online and offline.
benefits & perks
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. 
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life.
www.careers.walmart.com

live our values
culture champion
• models the walmart values to foster our culture; holds oneself and others accountable; and supports walmart’s commitment to communities, social justice, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability; maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics and compliance.
servant leadership
• acts as an altruistic servant leader and is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent.
embrace change
curiosity & courage
• demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; fosters an environment that supports learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks.
digital transformation & change
• seeks and implements continuous improvements and encourages the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working.
deliver for the customer
customer focus
• delivers expected business results while putting the customer first and consistently applying an omni-merchant mindset and the edlp and edlc business models to all plans.
strategic thinking
• adopts a holistic perspective that considers data, analytics, customer insights, and different parts of the business when making plans and shaping the team’s strategy.
focus on our associates
diversity, equity & inclusion
• identifies, attracts, and retains diverse and inclusive team members; builds a high-performing team; embraces diversity in all its forms; and actively supports diversity goal programs.
collaboration & influence
• builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives; and communicates with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action.
talent management
• creates a discipline and focus around developing talent, promotes an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work, empowers associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer and company, and regularly recognizes others’ contributions and accomplishments.

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
:
strong working knowledge in ms excel
at least one year experience in contact center/marketplace, or as an analyst in any domain
you’ll sweep us off our feet if:
you have a strong analytical background
you have experience with excel, salesforce, jira, confluence, word, & outlook
you are comfortable working in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment
you have an eye at anticipating roadblocks
you have a thirst for data

about walmart global tech
imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people and put a smile on their face. that’s what we do at walmart global tech. we’re a team of 15,000+ software engineers, data scientists and service professionals within walmart, the world’s largest retailer, delivering innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2.3 million associates. to others, innovation looks like an app, service, or some code, but walmart has always been about people. people are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. being human-led is our true disruption. we train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. we have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.
flexible, hybrid work
we use a hybrid way of working that is primarily virtual, while remaining near the locations global tech calls home. this approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team, be more flexible in our personal lives and spend less time commuting. of course, being together in person is an important part of our culture and shared success. we use our campuses to collaborate and be together in person, as business needs require and for development and networking opportunities.

benefits:
beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more.

equal opportunity employer:
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
:
four-year college degree.
ability to lead day-to-day relationships and work with management and multifunctional teams to respond to supplier needs.
experience in building media plan recommendations.
excellent follow-through and no hesitation in ensuring accountability across teams.
meticulously detail-oriented project management to ensure we increase the strength of our relationships with suppliers and their investment in walmart advertising.
familiarity with analytics, advertising data/tech, and dmp technologies, paired with strong analytical and quantitative skills, problem-solving.
resourceful in maneuvering through a large company while working in a nimble and fast paced environment – ability to adapt and thrive in any business situation.
willingness and desire to be a key individual contributor and strong team player.
strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills along with cross company and partner collaboration skills. ability to be clear, concise, and effective in communication.
capability to work proactively under pressure and handling multiple ad hoc requests.
high level of comfort escalating and presenting key issues to management.
tactical and strategic thinker to help influence suppliers’ investment in walmart media/advertising.
about walmart connect
at walmart, we are passionate in our endeavor to continuously bridge the gap between supplier brands and retail shoppers at an unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, “save money. live better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a growing, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. our team believes all digital advertising can be targeted and quantified – and we have walmart’s sales data to prove it! our team and our supplier partners win when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth for their business both online and offline.
benefits & perks
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. 
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life.
www.careers.walmart.com

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, economics, mathematics, business administration, marketing).
5+ years of experience in integrated marketing strategy & analytics and measurement, and multiple priorities & milestones.
project management experience in dealing with a high volume of reporting/analyses requests.
experience in the languages of data manipulation (e.g., sql, r) and in visualization (tableau, datorama).
experience in omnichannel marketing, attribution, and roi measurement, including performance and awareness of online advertising.
strong organizational skills, with the ability to effectively manage projects, communicate effectively.
experience and passion for working in a fast-paced agile environment, delivering functional features in small time durations.
demonstrated ability to speak to technical topics and metrics in an understandable manner.
high proficiency in ms excel and powerpoint.
preferred qualifications
master’s degree or phd in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, economics, mathematics, business administration, marketing).
experience in media and marketing measurement, analytics, and reporting within an advertising agency/consulting.
experience with online advertising, targeting and measurement systems and methodologies (ad servers, dsps, dmps, etc.).
well-versed in advertising technology, including 3rd party ad-serving and tag management solutions and programmatic ad buying platform.
ability to work through ambiguity and drive for clarity of direction.
experience with project management platforms like jira.
experience with a/b and multivariate test design and implementation and statistical concepts.
experience in developing and presenting strategic, action-oriented recommendations from complex analytics efficiently and engagingly to an executive audience.
experience with relationship building/management with internal stakeholders including marketing, product and engineering. 
about walmart connect
at walmart, we’ve led retail for over 60 years by keeping our customers’ needs at the center of everything we do. our latest innovations leverage our online reach and massive network of physical stores to save 160 million weekly omnichannel customers time and money in ways no other retailer can match.  
walmart connect is building a robust in-house advertising business that’s key to walmart’s growth strategy. we partner closely with brands on strategies and solutions that harness walmart’s unparalleled omnichannel influence. we deliver relevant retail ads and experiences that connect our customers with the brands and products they love. and we use walmart’s proprietary online and in-store data, encompassing 95% of american households, to measure campaign-correlated sales on our site and in our stores.  
walmart isn’t simply the world’s most successful retailer — we’re the world’s largest company. this is a unique opportunity to be part of a high-visibility team backed by the most talented retail colleagues in the world and over six decades of success. join us.
at walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. paid time off benefits include pto (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, military leave pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
you will also receive pto and/or ppto that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. the amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. it will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. for information about pto, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .
live better u is a walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in walmart and sam's club facilities. programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including english language learning and short-form certificates. tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by walmart.
eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. for information about benefits and eligibility, see one.walmart at https://bit.ly/3ioob1j .
the annual salary range for this position is $120,000.00-$180,000.00
additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.
additional compensation for certain positions may also include:
- regional pay zone (rpz) (based on location)
- stock equity incentives

about walmart connect
at walmart, we enable the connection between supplier brands and retail shoppers at unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, "save money. live better," we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. we believe all digital advertising can be targeted and accountable – and we have walmart's sales data to prove it.

:

3+ years of experience in project management

2+ years of experience leading cross functional teams and influencing change behavior 
strong organizational skills, a keen sense of ownership and accountability, and the ability to lead projects, communicate effectively, and be a self-starter

 preferred qualifications:

 more about we operate at walmart.com 
 live our values:  
culture champion - models the walmart values to foster our culture; holds oneself and others accountable; and supports walmart's commitment to communities, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability; maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics, and compliance. 
 servant leadership - acts as an altruistic servant leader and is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent. 
 embrace change:  
curiosity & courage - demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; fosters an environment that supports learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks. 
 digital transformation & change - seeks and implements continuous improvements and encourages the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working. 
 deliver for the customer:  
customer focus - delivers expected business results while putting the customer first and consistently applying an omni-merchant mindset 
 strategic thinking - adopts a holistic perspective that considers data, analytics, customer insights, and various parts of the business when making plans and shaping the team's strategy. 
 focus on our associates:  
diversity, equity & inclusion - identifies, attracts, and retains diverse and inclusive team members; builds a high-performing team; embraces diversity in all its forms; and actively supports diversity goal programs. 
 collaboration & influence - builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives; and communicates with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action. 
 talent management 
creates a discipline and focus around developing talent, promotes an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work, empowers associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer and company, and regularly recognizes others' contributions and accomplishments.

  benefits & perks:  
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more.  
  equal opportunity employer  
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.  
live our values
culture champion
• models the walmart values to foster our culture; holds oneself and others accountable; and supports walmart’s commitment to communities, social justice, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability; maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics and compliance.
servant leadership
• acts as an altruistic servant leader and is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent.
embrace change
curiosity & courage
• demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; fosters an environment that supports learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks.
digital transformation & change
• seeks and implements continuous improvements and encourages the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working.
deliver for the customer
customer focus
• delivers expected business results while putting the customer first and consistently applying an omni-merchant mindset and the edlp and edlc business models to all plans.
strategic thinking
• adopts a holistic perspective that considers data, analytics, customer insights, and different parts of the business when making plans and shaping the team’s strategy.
focus on our associates
diversity, equity & inclusion
• identifies, attracts, and retains diverse and inclusive team members; builds a high-performing team; embraces diversity in all its forms; and actively supports diversity goal programs.
collaboration & influence
• builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives; and communicates with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action.
talent management
• creates a discipline and focus around developing talent, promotes an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work, empowers associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer and company, and regularly recognizes others’ contributions and accomplishments.

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
what you'll do...
position: senior manager ii, integrated planning - supply chain
job location: 2101 se simple savings dr., bentonville, ar 72712
duties: manages the development of the integrated flow planning platform by ensuring the design, development, and analysis of complex fulfillment scenarios within the platform to support supply chain and operational needs; ensuring the integrated planning model represents optimal business processes from end-to-end; building cross-functional support for flow plans; and collaborating with key functional leaders to proactively influence plan adjustments to drive optimal business results. ensures flow modeling and prioritization information drives business actions by communicating and collaborating with key stakeholders; ensuring modeling and prioritization data is distributed in a timely manner; and managing plan adjustments to related plans (for example, merchant financial plans, store staffing) when business action is necessary. oversees the dc (distribution center) flow forecasting direction by managing the execution of advanced analytical models to help increase dc operational efficiencies; managing case volume and trailer forecasts to ensure effectiveness; ensuring the development of flow process insights to identify changes in trends and instructing and providing corrective action when needed; and managing cross-functional partnerships to drive prioritization efforts and promote optimal forecasting results. drives continuous improvement efforts in forecasting accuracy by partnering with dc leaders and operators to understand operational needs; generating ways to leverage accurate forecasts to reduce operational costs (for example, labor planning, trailer procurement planning); establishing and maintaining collaborative work environment; maintaining current on latest technological development in the forecasting field (for example, machine learning, pattern recognition); and implementing technological developments appropriately to support technical and business resources. (supervises 2: senior manager i – integrated planning – supply chain & senior manager i – integrated planning, supply chain management, ecomm).
minimum education and experience required: bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in computer science, engineering, or related field plus 5 years of experience in engineering or related experience; or master’s degree or the equivalent in computer science, engineering, or related field plus 2 years of experience in engineering or related experience.
skills required: must have experience with: set up s&oe process for weekly planning and performance review; design and set up labor planning and scheduling process to support north america operations; hire and mentor the best talent aligned with long term vision of the org; optimize capacity planning by setting up highly efficient forecasting systems/processes; develop sku level forecasts to improve in-stock management meeting sporadic customer demand with high precision; minitab and matlab for analytics, sql for data extraction, and tableau for data visualization; agile project management with the help of confluence and six sigma toolkit(s); integration of closed loop supply chain processes ranging from planning, forecasting, procurement, system deployment, warehousing, to driving customer satisfaction; managing product development from concept to deployment and integrating with existing business tools for efficient supply chain systems; establishing kpis by engaging stakeholders to design, measure, analyze, improve, and control business performance(s); negotiate contracts with transportation service providers, suppliers, oems to drive cost savings in business. employer will accept any amount of experience with the required skills.
#li-dnp #li-dni
wal-mart is an equal opportunity employer.

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
what you'll do...
position: manager ii, technical project management
job location: 603 munger ave, dallas, tx 75202
duties: ensures project manager development and continued successful performance by providing mentoring; monitoring program and individual project progress; providing periodic project status reports and executive summaries to stakeholders and management; developing new project managers to ensure skills are aligned with established project management organization (pmo) standards; and providing mentorship and guidance to peers and management on methodology and practice. develops project management practices by adhering to the principles of the walmart global ecommerce (gec) project management methodologies (for example, agile); promoting the principles and business value of the project methodologies throughout the organization; leading and contributing to the development and improvement of the global ecommerce project methodologies; leading lessons learned meetings; and participating in established feedback channels. manages geographically distributed teams, offshore development teams and third-party vendors (for example, software vendors, hardware vendors, photo vendors, content providers) by coordinating internal and vendor schedules; integrating teams and vendors into project strategy; communicating progress status; ensuring delivery of proper functionality; and managing communications from vendors to internal stakeholders. manages multiple, highly complex ecommerce projects (for example, software development, infrastructure) with external stakeholders (for example, third-party vendors, information system division (isd), store innovations) by driving projects through the lifecycle phases to successful completion as defined in project's charter; serving as the project team lead (for example, scrum master); managing project budget; developing and maintaining a project schedule to track milestones; developing and executing plans for managing risk; providing updates and communicating needed changes to project budget; escalating project-related issues to management in according to project guidelines and requirements; providing project status reports to stakeholders and management; managing project change control processes; coordinating production issue resolution; interpreting data to help guide teams towards issue resolution and risk management; and making recommendations regarding solutions to problems or issues.
minimum education and experience required: bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in computer science, information technology, engineering, or related field plus 5 years of experience in technical program management or related experience; or master’s degree or the equivalent in computer science, information technology, engineering, or related field plus 2 years of experience in technical program management or related experience.
skills required: must have experience with: creating data analysis and data comparison reports on different data source systems using sql/pl sql; developing and implementing data quality rules and frameworks in tools like collibra; designing and developing data quality and kpi dashboards in front end tools like tableau and power bi; performing data assessment and data profiling using sql or collibra to ensure that data is fit for purpose; maintaining the data quality metrics above a threshold by performing continuous issue management in collibra or jira; creating and managing data dictionary, business glossary and data quality rule repository in collibra; designing and implementing data governance strategy using dama (data management association) principles; establishing and implementing best practice processes (sop) and policies across teams for master data management (mdm); creating ad hoc reports on item master, customer master data and sales transaction data using query languages like sql/plsql; analyzing the architecture of data structures of source systems and target systems and, based on the analysis, perform as-is/to-be data mappings between the systems; developing etl (extract, transform, load) strategy to perform data migration from different upstream source systems to target system for customer master data and item master data and transaction data; agile environment; and ticketing tools like jira and servicenow. employer will accept any amount of graduate coursework, graduate research experience or experience with the required skills.
#li-dnp #li-dni
wal-mart is an equal opportunity employer.

QUALIFICATIONS:
bachelor's degree in business, economics, finance, statistics, or related field and 2 years of experience in a strategy or advisory role (e.g., management consulting, strategy and operations, or similar role)
experience building presentations and developing narratives for executive audiences
experience working cross-functionally
preferred qualifications
master’s degree in economics, finance, statistics or quantitative field

experience manipulating data, generating insights from analyses, and communicating findings to an executive audience

benefits & perks: 
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, and much more. 
about u.s. walmart marketplace team
want to help change the future of online commerce? we are building a new type of customer-centric shopping experience at the intersection of content, commerce, and technology; and we want you to be a part of it! the walmart marketplace business is part of walmart’s ecommerce portfolio and is one of the fastest growing and most profitable business units. this growth has made walmart marketplace a highly strategic priority for walmart for the next 5 years. the marketplace team culture is entrepreneurial, fast paced, relentless, biased for action and highly resilient. the team is on a crucial mission to make walmart marketplace the preferred destination for sellers and customers and to leverage our scale and capabilities to differentiate across the ecommerce industry.
equal opportunity employer 
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. 
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com
at walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. paid time off benefits include pto (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, military leave pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
you will also receive pto and/or ppto that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. the amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. it will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. for information about pto, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .
live better u is a walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in walmart and sam's club facilities. programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including english language learning and short-form certificates. tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by walmart.
eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. for information about benefits and eligibility, see one.walmart at https://bit.ly/3ioob1j .
the annual salary range for this position is $97,500.00-$162,500.00
additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.
additional compensation for certain positions may also include:
- regional pay zone (rpz) (based on location)
- stock equity incentives

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
10+ years hands on experience of building and capability to manage high performing teams.
experience driving revenue growth with emerging opportunities and established partnerships
strong understanding of the advertising technology and data/performance measurement trends
skilled storyteller with experience communicating the benefit of marketing opportunities to brands
exceptional communication and presentation skills with an emphasis on translating insights, product information, and data in to client value
ability to perform well in highly dynamic, rapidly changing environment
proven ability to forge relationships with top marketing decision makers at brands and agencies
demonstrable success as a leader of change, achieving operational excellence by introducing new performance measures, processes and systems
provide strong leadership with the ability to build, train, coach and develop a high performing team including providing coaching and mentoring to other team leads
demonstrated track record in leading a team to surpass its targets and significantly grow the scale of the business partnerships under their control
ability to move fast, be bold, and thrive in a dynamic, quickly-changing environment
ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with a strong focus on collaboration
cultural qualifications
customer-obsessed, curious, collaborative, consultative, courageous and competitive
focused
interested in understanding a business’s finances
authentic and passionate
respectful, inclusive, honest, transparent
self-aware
positive and solutions-oriented
sense of humor
accountable
adaptive
empathetic
about walmart connect
at walmart, we enable the connection between supplier brands and retail shoppers at unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, “save money. live better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. we believe all digital advertising can be targeted and accountable – and we have walmart’s sales data to prove it. walmart connect wins when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth; walmart and our supplier partners win when your digital expertise helps sell more goods online and offline. growth in our digital advertising business is key to walmart’s overall growth strategy.
walmart connect is dedicated to driving measurable outcomes for our suppliers, sellers, merchants, stores, gms, brand advertisers, and agencies. our full funnel ad solutions leverage walmart’s in-store and online data, extensive reach, and to provide measurable results for our clientele. with a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service; these solutions help businesses build brand awareness, engage with walmart consumers, and convert walmart consumers to shoppers.
#wmc

benefits & perks
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto multiple health plans, and much more.
 equal opportunity employer
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.

who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement. from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com
live our values
culture champion
• models the walmart values to foster our culture; holds oneself and others accountable; and supports walmart’s commitment to communities, social justice, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability; maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics and compliance.
servant leadership
• acts as an altruistic servant leader and is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent.
embrace change
curiosity & courage
• demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; fosters an environment that supports learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks.

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
:
bachelors degree is required.
2-3 years professional end to end digital media campaign management experience with the following skills:
campaign management experience managing the day-to-day campaign maintenance, including internal and external questions regarding accurate campaign implementation, pacing, and the performance of various campaigns.
experience with media planning, building media plans, and firm understanding of traditional and interactive media planning elements.
experience with multiple digital media products and channels: social, display, mobile, search, paid, programmatic, etc. specifically, keyboard experience within paid channels such as display, mobile, social, search, and programmatic, etc.
experience in bid management, campaign management, campaign optimization, digital media operations across search and display.
client facing experience with the ability to identify risks and effectively navigate through issues. including regularly consulting sales teams on insights to clients detailing performance, campaign optimizations, and new opportunities.
experience working with integrated teams by partnering closely with account management, finance, sales, advanced analytics, optimization, etc.
skills:
strong analytical thinking, mathematical skills.
professional hands-on experience building and delivering media plans for new client opportunities using strategic insights and best practices.
proficiency in microsoft office solutions. outlook, powerpoint, excel
excellent communication and writing skills.
strong project management skills.
ability to advise partners on best practices and areas of opportunity.
excited by a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
experience using project management tools and ad servers.
flexibility to provide after-hours support on a rotational basis.
about walmart connect
at walmart, we are passionate in our endeavor to continuously bridge the gap between supplier brands and retail shoppers at an unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, “save money. live better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a growing, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. our team believes all digital advertising can be targeted and quantified – and we have walmart’s sales data to prove it! our team and our supplier partners win when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth for their business both online and offline.
benefits & perks
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, annual stock grants, espp, and much more. the salary wage range for this position is $78750 to $131250*

bachelor’s degree in marketing, brand design, business or other related field and 4+ years of work experience in brand strategy or at a design agency
background in: cpg brand marketing, sales, consulting, or other leadership development program experience (industry agnostic)
understanding of brand strategy development, brand positioning, brand creation, and consumer insights
strong creative acumen and ability to write a compelling strategy brief and assess work against a defined strategy

ability to work in an ambiguous and dynamic work environment with competing priorities
demonstrated comfort and capability with brands in all stages of growth
ability to influence and inspire direct and cross-functional team

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
8+ years of experience in product marketing and 5+ years of experience in the online advertising industry. 
a solid understanding of advertising technologies 
proven ability to form relationships and lead cross functional teams 
embrace working in a fast paced continually evolving environment 
exceptional communication skills in both writing and presentation 
analytical and data-driven 
structured and a strategic thinker 
proficient in microsoft office applications (excel, powerpoint, word, and outlook) 
 at walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. paid time off benefits include pto (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, military leave pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
you will also receive pto and/or ppto that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. the amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. it will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. for information about pto, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .
live better u is a walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in walmart and sam's club facilities. programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including english language learning and short-form certificates. tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by walmart.
eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. for information about benefits and eligibility, see one.walmart at https://bit.ly/3ioob1j .
the annual salary range for this position is $119,000.00-$221,000.00
additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.
additional compensation for certain positions may also include:
- regional pay zone (rpz) (based on location)
- stock equity incentives

TITLE: Walmart
QUALIFICATIONS:
:
bachelors degree is required.
2-3 years professional end to end digital media campaign management experience with the following skills:
campaign management experience managing the day-to-day campaign maintenance, including internal and external questions regarding accurate campaign implementation, pacing, and the performance of various campaigns.
experience with media planning, building media plans, and firm understanding of traditional and interactive media planning elements.
experience with multiple digital media products and channels: social, display, mobile, search, paid, programmatic, etc. specifically, keyboard experience within paid channels such as display, mobile, social, search, and programmatic, etc.
experience in bid management, campaign management, campaign optimization, digital media operations across search and display.
client facing experience with the ability to identify risks and effectively navigate through issues. including regularly consulting sales teams on insights to clients detailing performance, campaign optimizations, and new opportunities.
experience working with integrated teams by partnering closely with account management, finance, sales, advanced analytics, optimization, etc.
skills:
strong analytical thinking, mathematical skills.
professional hands-on experience building and delivering media plans for new client opportunities using strategic insights and best practices.
proficiency in microsoft office solutions. outlook, powerpoint, excel
excellent communication and writing skills.
strong project management skills.
ability to advise partners on best practices and areas of opportunity.
excited by a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
experience using project management tools and ad servers.
flexibility to provide after-hours support on a rotational basis.
about walmart connect
at walmart, we are passionate in our endeavor to continuously bridge the gap between supplier brands and retail shoppers at an unprecedented scale. as primary stewards of our brand promise, “save money. live better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150m households who shop with us. this is a unique opportunity to join a growing, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. our team believes all digital advertising can be targeted and quantified – and we have walmart’s sales data to prove it! our team and our supplier partners win when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth for their business both online and offline.
benefits & perks
beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, pto, multiple health plans, annual stock grants, espp, and much more.
equal opportunity employer
walmart, inc. is an equal opportunity employer – by choice. we believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. that means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.
who we are
join walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. yes, we are the fortune #1 company. but you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. a career at walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  from day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life.
www.careers.walmart.com
